intro: Hieracium sphaerocranum, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, spiny seed heads that resemble a globe, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its flowers are blue to purple in color and bloom in the summer months. Hieracium sphaerocranum is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
